Legal_Issue: Whether the absence of use of the trademark CFP by IBCFP in Canada can be excused due to special circumstances
Evidence_Assessment: New evidence showing continuous use by the College and special circumstances
Decision_Outcome: Appeal allowed; absence of use excused due to special circumstances
Burden_of_Proof: On trademark owner to justify non-use under special circumstances
Credibility_Factor: Inadvertent failure to appoint College as registered user
Legal_Rule: Section 44(3) allows expungement unless special circumstances excuse non-use
Procedural_Issue: Appeal with new evidence not previously before Registrar
Review_Standard: Reasonableness or correctness, depending on context
Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Applicant had opportunity to present new evidence on appeal
Key_Evidence_Considered: Continuous use by the College, intent to use, inadvertent administrative omission
Applicant_Challenge: Registrar's decision to expunge for non-use
Legal_Rule_Source: Statutory: Section 44(3) of the Trade-marks Act
Defendant_Response: Not explicitly stated, but Registrar defended expungement decision
Evidence_Type: Documentary and factual evidence of use and intent
Authority: Canadian Intellectual Property Office (CIPO), reviewed by Court
Applicable_Process: Administrative review followed by judicial appeal
